meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>inherit</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to inherit</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: You not only inherit one fortune, but <reading>two</reading>! You're lucky both sides of your family "accidentally" died at the same time. <reading>TWO</reading> (つ) fortunes! TWO! HAHAHAHA. Also, you can think of it like the つ of 次, because you are the "next" successor when you inherit something.
